definition: variant of 熱衷|热衷[re4 zhong1]
to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Many merchants were not slow to cash in on the current China craze.
sentences.chinese: 許多商人都急於在流行的中國熱中撈一把。

sentences.english: Hal goes in for tennis while his wife goes in for painting and sculpture.
sentences.chinese: 哈爾熱中於網球，而他太太是投入繪畫及雕刻。

sentences.english: She is happily married to her husband Joe, a business executive and avid boater .
sentences.chinese: 她愉快地與結婚對她的丈夫喬，商業主管和熱中船民。

sentences.english: The doodle is the latest in the recent rehabilitation of Confucius.
sentences.chinese: 在近來孔子復興熱中這個塗鴉是最新的表現。

sentences.english: Excited to pick new and varied techniques.
sentences.chinese: 熱中於瞭解與學習最新的技術。

sentences.english: His work suffered because of his total absorption in sport.
sentences.chinese: 他熱中於運動而影響了工作。

sentences.english: He flipped over his new stereo.
sentences.chinese: 他熱中於他的新立體音響。

sentences.english: They were full of envy, murder, strife, deceit, maliciousness.
sentences.chinese: 他們妒忌，滿懷殺機，熱中紛爭，欺詐，用心險惡。

definition: touchstone/fig. test that sth is genuine
to kill two birds with one stone (idiom)
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
to be equal to/to be well-matched/rival
